-- Noir --

Noir nods then follows Devilcat. She has been looking forward to a 
battle for some time, doing nothing has become rather boring.

Silently and obediently, Noir follows suit of the other Rogues, and 
easily enables her cloacking, and takes off.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> "We'll see," Gatara says noncomittally.  She stalks out of the 
room 
> and down the hall, coming to a stop only when she reaches the main 
> entry hatch, where the other Rogues - except Riekan and Jayde - 
have 
> already gathered.
> 
> Those two soon show up as well, Jayde having to jog a little to 
keep 
> up with Riekan's much longer strides.  Devilcat smiles as he sees 
the 
> group fully assembled.
> 
> The Rogue leader quickly outlines his plan. "Here's the bit.  
Torin, 
> you and Jayde keep an eye on the ship - and our 'guest'."  Jayde 
> pouts at being left behind; Devilcat ignores it and continues 
> on.  "If you want, you can work on those jammer beacons.  In the 
> meantime, things are coming to a head at the Predacon base.  
Hydras 
> has asked for support in his much-anticipated clash with the 
Maximals 
> and their allies; I don't intend to disappoint him.  Gatara, Fury, 
> Noir, Riekan, it's time to cloak and fly."
> 
> With that, the fuzor leads his war-party outside and to the air.  
> 
> OOC: Cloaking in transit is pretty much standard procedure for the 
> Rogues.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > OOC: It's okay
> > 
> > BIC:
> > 
> > Yggdrasil: This means I'm not invited, right? That's good for 
me. 
> Tell 
> > me when I'm allowed out, okay?
> > 
> > He sits down in the spot and brings up a holoprojected solitaire 
> game.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > OOC: Correct me if I'm wrong, I'm assuming he's on the move 
here.
> > > 
> > > Gatara holds up a finger.  "Not so fast, Maximal.  Computer, 
> > activate 
> > > containment protocol alpha!"  'Containment protocal alpha' 
means 
> the 
> > > computer takes advantage of projectors located throughout the 
> ship 
> > to 
> > > trap all non-Rogues aboard in unbreakable force fields.  The 
> fields 
> > > deactivate only on a voice command from a Rogue of equal or 
> higher 
> > > rank to the one who triggered them in the first place.
> > > 
> > > This means Yggdrasil now has about a foot to move in any given 
> > > direction.
